abstract_summ: Maths can help plug some of the gaps, says Adam KucharskiWe don't know if changing seasons will help stem the outbreak, says Michael Le PageEpidemic diseases are not a new phenomenon, but easy access to transport in the modern world has accelerated their spread.What is it like to be a covid-19 contact tracer and what do they do?The new coronavirus may be upending our lives, but we aren't helpless against itThe novel coronavirus that emerged in Wuhan has exploded worldwide.Getting a full picture of the coronavirus outbreak is extremely difficult.What happens if it goes pandemic?Perhaps some botanical understanding can help slow them down.
title_summ: Calculating virus spreadWill heat kill the coronavirus?Redeploying plant defencesTracking down coronavirusA strange new worldWhat happens next?
